metadata.title: CVE-2022-48877 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:f2fs: let's avoid panic if extent_tree is not createdThis patch avoids the below panic.pc : __lookup_extent_tree+0xd8/0x760lr : f2fs_do_write_data_page+0x104/0x87csp : ffffffc010cbb3c0x29: ffffffc010cbb3e0 x28: 0000000000000000x27: ffffff8803e7f020 x26: ffffff8803e7ed40x25: ffffff8803e7f020 x24: ffffffc010cbb460x23: ffffffc010cbb480 x22: 0000000000000000x21: 0000000000000000 x20: ffffffff22e90900x19: 0000000000000000 x18: ffffffc010c5d080x17: 0000000000000000 x16: 0000000000000020x15: ffffffdb1acdbb88 x14: ffffff888759e2b0x13: 0000000000000000 x12: ffffff802da49000x11: 000000000a001200 x10: ffffff8803e7ed40x9 : ffffff8023195800 x8 : ffffff802da49078x7 : 0000000000000001 x6 : 0000000000000000x5 : 0000000000000006 x4 : ffffffc010cbba28x3 : 0000000000000000 x2 : ffffffc010cbb480x1 : 0000000000000000 x0 : ffffff8803e7ed40Call trace: __lookup_extent_tree+0xd8/0x760 f2fs_do_write_data_page+0x104/0x87c f2fs_write_single_data_page+0x420/0xb60 f2fs_write_cache_pages+0x418/0xb1c __f2fs_write_data_pages+0x428/0x58c f2fs_write_data_pages+0x30/0x40 do_writepages+0x88/0x190 __writeback_single_inode+0x48/0x448 writeback_sb_inodes+0x468/0x9e8 __writeback_inodes_wb+0xb8/0x2a4 wb_writeback+0x33c/0x740 wb_do_writeback+0x2b4/0x400 wb_workfn+0xe4/0x34c process_one_work+0x24c/0x5bc worker_thread+0x3e8/0xa50 kthread+0x150/0x1b4

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48877` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-209-generic - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-209-generic - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-209-lowlatency - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1154-aws - 4.15.0-1154.167~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-azure - 4.15.0-1163.178~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1148-gcp - 4.15.0-1148.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1117-oracle - 4.15.0-1117.128~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1154.167~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1163.178~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1148.164~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1117.128~16.04.1').
